references.paper_title: Particle Markov Chain Monte Carlo Methods
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the particle filtering methods used in the main paper for probabilistic inference.
This paper introduces the concept of process reward models (PRMs), which are crucial to the proposed inference-time scaling approach.

references.paper_title: Scaling test-time compute with open models
references.reason: This paper explores various inference-time scaling methods, serving as a strong baseline and comparison for the proposed method.

references.paper_title: The lessons of developing process reward models in mathematical reasoning
references.reason: This paper provides insights into the design and application of PRMs, which are essential to the proposed method's use of reward models.

references.paper_title: Qwen2.5-math technical report: Toward mathematical expert model via self-improvement
references.reason: This paper introduces the Qwen2.5-Math models, used in the experiments as an example of the policy models for generating solutions.
